### Tender for Communications Consultant (Senior) Services
#### Request for Proposal (#24-248059)

The Canadian Government has released a Request for Proposal (RFP) for the provision of Communications Consultant (Senior) services to the Office of the Canadian Ombudsperson for Responsible Enterprise (CORE). The proposed contract will be a Tier 1 requirement under the E60ZT-18TSPS Supply Arrangement.

### Description of the Requirement
CORE is seeking a skilled Communications Consultant (Senior) to provide strategic and executive communications advice on a monthly retainer basis. The successful candidate will be responsible for advising the Ombud on effective communication strategies to engage key stakeholders, including media, public, government, and private sector organizations. The agreed-upon period of contract will commence on October 1, 2023, and is expected to last one (1) year with two optional one-year extensions.

### Level of Security Requirement
The contractor must have Canadian Security Clearance at a level adequate to meet the Needs of the Canadian Government. The resource security level will be the equivalent of Protected B, while the document safeguarding security level will be at a level of Confirmed - FSC (Foreign Service Category).

### Documents Required
Proposals must be submitted in the format outlined in the Request for Proposal document. This document is available at [insert website or document location].

### Agreement Provisions
The proposed contract will be subject to the Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA) and other applicable international trade agreements, including the World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO-AGP) and the Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA).

### Burden of Proof
All information must be accurate and complete, and the minister reserves the right to reject any submission that does not meet all of the Terms and Conditions specified in the Request for Proposal.

### Evaluation Criteria
The proposals will be evaluated based on the following criteria:
- Levels of effort
- Communications strategies and proposed approaches
- Expertise and experience in the specialized areas of communication and business and human rights
- Quality of workplan and timeline
- Quality of resumes
- Price

### Exclusion Criteria
Selected contractors will be required to undergo a security clearance check prior to being awarded the contract. Only contractors with suitable clearances will be eligible.

### How to Submit a Proposal
Proposals must be submitted via the Industry Sourcing Portal or by mail to the mailing address on the reverse side of this document. The closing date for proposals is 14:00
